* The theorem states that all obstructions to the deformation of a pasting diagram are cocycles if certain conditions are met.
* The method reduces the deformation of complex pasting diagrams to simpler diagrams with specified trivial deformations.
* The approach involves using parallels and well-formed labelings of polygons and spheres to analyze deformations and obstructions.
</summary>

<summary>
* Physics aims to understand physical phenomena by selecting essential degrees of freedom.
* The spontaneous breaking of chiral symmetry is crucial in QCD for understanding nucleon mass and properties.
* The Nambu and Jona-Lasinio model illustrates how constituent quarks acquire dynamical mass.
* The chiral constituent quark model provides a unified description of nonstrange and strange baryon spectra.
* Short-range repulsion in the nucleon-nucleon system is attributed to the same chiral interaction that produces hyperfine splittings in baryon spectroscopy.
</summary>

<summary>
* Fabricated implantable NGC for nerve regeneration
* Spiral structured porous sheet with surface channels and aligned fibers
* Tunable features for varying length and diameter
* Improved mechanical strength, cell proliferation, and nerve regeneration compared to traditional methods
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to novel calcium phosphate-coated implantable medical devices and processes of making them.
• The coated devices minimize immune response and can store and release medicinally active agents.
• Metallic stents often lead to harmful side effects, but calcium phosphate coatings can reduce inflammation and infection.
• Polymer coatings on stents have limitations, leading to inflammatory responses and restenosis.
• Calcium phosphate coatings, such as hydroxyapatite, are bio-compatible and bio-resorbable.
• Various methods, such as sol-gel deposition, electrochemical deposition, and calcium phosphate cement, can be used to coat implantable devices.
• Porous coatings can accept drugs for controlled release.
• The process allows for customization of coating parameters for different implantable devices and materials.
• The coatings can be easily incorporated into current production practices for metallic implantable devices.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to seat base support assemblies for furniture using sinuous spring bands, wire grids, chord-rubber webbing, or flexible steel bands.
• The rail connectors provide torsioning, dynamic uplift, expansion-contraction, and leverage-amplification for enhanced seat performance.
• Two forms of rail connectors are described, one using a coil spring and the other using a cantilever spring configuration, to provide dynamic uplift and resilience to the seat base support assemblies.
</summary>

<summary>
* An anvil assembly for a surgical stapling device includes a stabilizing collet to prevent damage to the anvil shaft during attachment.
* The anvil shaft has flexible legs that define a longitudinal bore for coupling to the trocar of the stapling device.
* The stabilizing collet is cylindrical and substantially rigid, with cantilevered fingers and protrusions to secure it within the anvil shaft.
* The collet supports the flexible legs and minimizes damage caused by pressure during attachment.
* The trocar of the stapling device engages the flexible legs, allowing the anvil assembly to be securely connected.
* The collet does not interfere with the flexing of the legs during coupling to the trocar.
* The anvil assembly is designed for endoscopic surgical procedures and can be easily connected to the stapling device.
* The disclosed anvil assembly provides a crush-resistant design for reliable attachment and use in surgical procedures.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a container of a blender with high-speed blades mounted inside.
* Early blenders used glass containers, but later switched to reinforced plastic due to durability and cost efficiency.
* The inventors added a metal lining to the inner wall of the receptacle to improve hygiene and prevent debris from mixing into the liquid.
* The lining has teeth to grind fibers of vegetables and fruits, reducing stirring time and preserving the color and nutrition of the juice.
* Different embodiments of the container include half-mask or whole-mask linings, vertical ribs, stopper members, and teeth for grinding fibers.
* The lining can be made of metal, glass, or alloy, and can be combined with the cup through injection molding or prefabricated components.
* The design of the lining helps improve the efficiency of blending fruits and vegetables, reducing oxidization and preserving the quality of the juice.
</summary>

<summary>
• Garnish pick with one or more appendages for skewering and holding garnishes
• Appendages may project at various angles to simulate organisms or objects
• Some appendages may serve as hooks to secure the pick to a container
• Different embodiments show varying numbers and types of appendages
• Design prevents pick from becoming submerged in beverages
• Allows for easy removal of garnishes without touching them
• Materials can include wood, metal, plastic, rubber, glass, or ceramic
• Various shapes, sizes, and textures of the pick are possible
• Example pick includes multiple skewering shafts and a hook for glass rim
• Pick body may have multiple elongate body portions with tapered skewers and hooks
</summary>

<summary>
• Esophageal-stomach displacement electrode for medical procedures
• Electrode inserted down esophagus into stomach for heart stimulation
• Mechanism to bend distal end of electrode to displace stomach wall
• Control mechanism with cords to operate displacement mechanism
• Convenient noninvasive procedure to reduce energy required for pacing or defibrillation
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a combined cardiomyostimulator and cardiac pacer-cardioverter-defibrillator for cardiac assist systems.
• Cardiac assist systems aid patients with low cardiac output who cannot be treated with traditional methods.
• The invention includes a device and algorithm for detecting and treating cardiac arrhythmias.
• The system provides skeletal muscle graft stimulation and cardiac stimulation while managing arrhythmia detection.
• Muscle stimulation is inhibited during arrhythmia detection to ensure reliable sensing of cardiac events.
• The system delivers therapy for ventricular tachycardia and fibrillation based on detected intervals.
• Muscle stimulation is provided during defibrillation charging to maintain cardiac perfusion and reduce defibrillation thresholds.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an accommodating intraocular lens device for implantation in a subject's eye.
* The device comprises a lens chamber, a base lens, and a lens periphery.
* The lens chamber is elastically deformable and filled with a fluid or gel to provide accommodative power.
* The base lens provides corrective refractive power and is more rigid than the lens chamber.
* The device is resiliently biased to an unaccommodated state but actuates to an accommodated state in response to radial compressive forces.
* Different embodiments include features such as through-holes, raised protrusions, and troughs for fluid exchange and reduced material bulk.
* The IOL may be constructed with materials of varying Young's modulus to optimize deformation and refractive power.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a board game with a lake theme involving players acquiring, selling, and improving properties like lake areas, boat dealerships, and dams.
* Players move tokens around the board, purchasing properties, paying rent, and drawing cards with penalties, benefits, or instructions related to life at a lake.
* Properties are organized into groups with associated title deed cards indicating purchase prices, rental fees, and costs for improvements like lake cabins and marinas.
* Players must meet financial obligations by selling, transferring, or mortgaging properties, with bankruptcy resulting in elimination from the game.
* The game continues until all but one player is bankrupt, with the remaining player declared the winner.
* The game includes elements like dice, tokens, title deed cards, Makin A Wake and Sunken Chest cards, and spaces representing lake-related scenarios.
* The objective is to simulate the ups and downs of life at a lake, with players competing to be the last one standing in the game.
</summary>

<summary>
* Apparatus and method for treating tissues and wounds by combining fluid supply and suction drainage.
* Apparatus includes a movable rest, fluid reservoir, drip chamber, injection port, and suction pump.
* Method involves eliminating hydrostatic pressure, administering fluid intermittently, and detecting bleeding.
* Apparatus includes an open pore dressing pad, drainage port with open grid, and detection system for bleeding.
* Method for regenerative tissue treatment involves controlling fluid flow and maintaining suction pressure.
* Apparatus includes a drainage port device to prevent occlusion of dressing pores.
* Method for detecting bleeding includes monitoring fluid formation rates and providing alarms for detection.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a gravity-driven steerable vehicle for downhill racing.
* The vehicle can be ridden in a prone, face down, face forward position.
* It has at least two wheels or skis, a steering mechanism, and a braking system.
* The suspension system provides precise control in turns, especially on snow.
* The vehicle can be retrofitted with skis or a combination of skis and wheels for snow-covered terrain.
* The braking system includes hydraulic pistons and a blade for effective braking on snow and ice. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to imaging using Radial Reflection Diffraction Tomography.
* The method employs wave-based algorithms to map scattered energy waves to construct images.
* The invention can be used for intravascular imaging to characterize plaque in arteries.
* It can also be used for non-destructive evaluation in boreholes or to track underground contaminants.
* The Hilbert Space Inverse Wave algorithm is used for image reconstruction.
* The algorithm involves singular value decomposition and eigenvalue equations.
* The reconstruction process involves selecting the number of singular values for optimal results.
* The method is flexible and can accommodate various transducer configurations and frequencies.
* The invention allows for imaging of objects in a surrounding medium with improved resolution.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention concerns a biological oil composition derived from a marine copepod, rich in EPA, DHA, and SDA.
* The oil composition is effective in preventing and treating cardiovascular diseases like atherosclerosis and hypercholesterolemia.
* The oil composition contains high levels of wax esters, fatty alcohols, and astaxanthin, differentiating it from other marine oils.
* Studies in mice showed that the oil composition significantly reduced atherosclerotic plaque formation compared to EPA/DHA concentrate.
* The oil composition also lowered blood cholesterol levels in mice, indicating potential health benefits.
* The oil composition can be used in dietary supplements, functional foods, and pharmaceutical products for cardiovascular health. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Polyelectrolyte complexes in microparticulate form can contain active substances such as pharmacological agents, proteins, enzymes, and vaccines.
• These complexes can be prepared from biocompatible, biodegradable polyacids and polybases, with the active substance either embedded in the matrix or chemically bound to the complex.
• Particles can be prepared in various sizes, from nanometers to micrometers, and can be used for controlled release of active substances.
• Examples include formulations with cytostatics, proteins for vaccines, tetracycline, and daunorubicin, showing improved therapeutic properties and release profiles.
• Polyelectrolyte complex microparticles can also be used as echogenic contrast agents for ultrasonic diagnosis.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention of a golf ball teeing device for elderly or disabled golfers
• Device automatically unclamps ball and tee once tee is pushed into the ground
• Utilizes a golf club as a handle, lightweight and portable
• Can be used to retrieve golf tees from the ground
• Simple to use, no cumbersome controls, can be easily clipped onto golfer's apparel
</summary>

<summary>
* The present disclosure relates to a person support apparatus, such as a bed, with a mechanism for adjusting the height and orientation of a patient support frame.
* The apparatus includes leg assemblies with linear actuators for adjusting the height and inclination of the deck support frame.
* The deck support frame features inverted U-shaped channel elements with rollers for smooth movement and stability.
* A braking mechanism is incorporated into the castors at the foot and head ends of the bed for added safety and control.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a skin reflectance measuring apparatus for pathology and cosmetology applications.
• Existing methods for measuring surface reflectance are not suitable for skin reflectance.
• The apparatus includes a probe with fiber optics, a measuring device, and a display.
• The probe is small and flexible, allowing for measurements on small skin surfaces.
• The apparatus compensates for variations in emitted light and ambient light.
• Reflectance is calculated from specular and diffuse reflection values.
• Calibration is done by measuring reference surfaces to determine constants.
• Tests show correlation between visual reflectance and measured values.
• The apparatus provides an objective means of quantifying skin reflectance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to pelvic floor reconstruction using implants.
* The implants include straps for threading through ligaments in the pelvic area.
* A needle with a trap mechanism is used to thread the straps through tissues.
* The method allows for reliable anchoring of the mesh implant without additional perforations of the body.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a dental cleaning and massaging apparatus that provides hydraulic cleaning of teeth and massaging of gums.
• The apparatus includes a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members, air-sacks for massaging the gums, and hoses for providing water and cleaning fluid.
• Control box allows for operation with air only, water only, or a combination of both, with a remote control device for convenience.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument for laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures.
• The instrument includes a rigid arm extending between the working tip electrode and the insulating sleeve to improve visualization of the operation site.
• Different embodiments of the instrument feature working tip electrodes in various shapes for different surgical applications.
• An insulating jacket is placed on the arm to prevent unintentional cauterization of healthy tissue surrounding the operation site.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging apparatus with a magnet, patient receptacle, support plate, transmit/receive coils, and adjustable exposure positions.
• Known MRI apparatuses require adjustment of exposure parameters for different positions, leading to readjustment time of 10-90 seconds per position.
• The adjustment process optimizes RF chain and magnetic field homogeneity in the imaging volume.
• Patient-dependent adjustments are necessary for safety and image quality.
• The invention determines required adjustment parameters in advance, storing them for subsequent exposures.
• Adjustment parameters include support plate position, coil configurations, and control signals for various components.
• By pre-determining adjustment parameters, high-contrast exposures can be achieved quickly, even for larger body segments.
• The invention allows for reduced examination times and continuous tracking of contrast agent flow in procedures like subtraction angiography. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to fasteners for albums such as photographic albums and scrapbooks.
• Conventional albums use male and female screws for fastening, which can be inconvenient.
• The present invention provides a fastener with strap anchors and a strap for easy insertion and removal of pages.
• The strap is snap-locked into the channel of the strap anchors for secure fastening.
• The strap anchors can be adhesively attached to the covers of the album.
• A modified embodiment includes saw-tooth profile ribs for improved fixing of the strap in the channel.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention discloses methods and apparatus for providing ventilatory assistance matched to a subject's respiratory need.
* The apparatus includes a blower, mask, pressure and flow sensors, and a microprocessor for control.
* The method involves calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle, determining the degree of assistance needed, and adjusting pressure accordingly.
* Fuzzy logic algorithms are used to adjust the degree of assistance based on respiratory patterns and leaks.
* The system can handle sudden changes in leaks, irregular breathing patterns, and abnormal respiratory control.
* Parameters such as target ventilation, respiratory rate, and pressure modulation amplitude are user-adjustable.
* The system calculates normalized airflow, rate of change of airflow, and ventilation to adjust pressure support.
* The system uses fuzzy inference rules to determine the phase in the respiratory cycle and adjust pressure accordingly.
* The system provides ventilatory assistance tailored to the subject's needs, with immunity to sudden leaks and ability to handle various respiratory conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a sulky with two wheels on the same axis, designed for trotting races.
• Traditional sulkies are made of welded steel, but attempts with aluminum have failed due to poor strength.
• The new sulky design allows for lightweight materials and easy assembly by the user.
• The end frames are casted, and the crossbar is made of extruded aluminum for stability.
• The sulky is designed for easy storage and transportation in a flat package.
• The user can assemble the sulky with basic tools, resulting in a 40% weight reduction compared to traditional sulkies.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds, particularly in water-cooled generators.
* The system aims to remove air bubbles that can cause overheating and blockage in the cooling system.
* Prior art techniques did not address the ventilation of rotating parts like water feeds.
* The invention provides a bypass with inlets around the axis of rotation to remove air bubbles.
* Different embodiments of the bypass include arrangements in end faces, radial pipes, and coiled pipes.
* The bypass design includes means to increase hydrodynamic resistance for efficient air bubble removal.
* The bypass outlets open into the discharge duct to eliminate air bubbles from the system.
* The ventilation system is simple in design and construction, providing automatic removal of air bubbles in rotating water feeds.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for mounting glass panels in curved window bays of vehicles using flat, uncurved glass panels.
* Conventional methods involve pre-contouring and tempering glass panels, making them less flexible and more brittle.
* The new method involves flexing flat glass panels to fit curved window openings and using adhesive sealant to hold them in place.
* Resilient clips and reveal molding are used to secure the glass panel in the curved window opening.
* The method allows for the use of inexpensive flat glass panels, reducing costs compared to pre-contoured glass.
* The adhesive sealant cures to permanently fix the glass panel in place, maintaining its curved shape. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an apparatus for removing a gas from a liquid, particularly suited for use on offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms.
* The apparatus includes a vessel with multiple gasification chambers, gas ingesting mechanisms, and a continuous flow process to displace the undesired gas with an inert gas.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a steering column for a motor vehicle with a jacket unit supporting a steering shaft rotatably.
• The jacket unit is connected to a retaining part across an energy absorption connection and a break-away connection.
• The steering column is adjustable in length and height or inclination.
• The retaining part is connected to the bracket unit with a securement device in the closed state.
• An elastic prestress is exerted on at least one bending wire or strip connecting the jacket unit and the retaining part.
• The prestress reduces the force required to release the break-away connection in the event of a crash.
• The energy absorption connection absorbs energy during a crash by deforming the bending wire or strip.
• The break-away connection is released if the force exceeds a limit value, allowing the jacket unit to dislocate with respect to the retaining part.
• The implementation of the prestress helps dampen noise in the steering column.
• The steering column can be adjusted in length and height or inclination, providing flexibility and safety features.
</summary>

<summary>
• The disclosure relates to a packaging machine with multiple work stations operated in synchronism with each other, driven by a common shaft.
• The shaft converts rotational movement into the required tool movements through transfer mechanisms like toggle levers or cam mechanisms.
• The compact design of the machine allows for efficient synchronization of tool movements, reducing the need for separate drives and electronic synchronization. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to finishing articles with a mounting hub for quick attachment to power tools.
• Traditional methods of securing grinding wheels to drive shafts required tools for removal.
• Adhesive was used to secure mounting hubs to grinding wheels, but rotational movement was still an issue.
• The invention introduces a drive member assembly with a backing flange, retaining nut, and pressure cap for secure attachment without adhesives.
• The pressure cap provides compression to prevent rotation of the grinding wheel during use.
• The assembly is easy to assemble, lightweight, vibration-free, and cost-effective.
• The design accommodates various sizes of grinding wheels and meets safety standards.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is based on a generic hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system.
• The hydraulic unit diverts pressure fluid entrained by pump pistons away from vulnerable electrical components.
• A conduit system is used to collect pressure fluid from the cam element chamber and store it in spring chambers.
• Pressure equalization between the spring chambers and the motor interior is achieved through dual utilization of conduit portions.
• The housing block can be produced economically with fewer conduits and easy cleaning after production.
• The design allows for cost savings and a hermetic seal of the unit from the environment.
• Pressure equalization conduits are used to prevent water ingress and maintain pressure equilibrium.
• Sealing elements and closure elements prevent pressure fluid from reaching sensitive components.
• Cable sheaths are utilized for pressure equalization between the motor and the housing, preventing water intrusion.
• The design prevents electrolytically active pressure fluid from damaging electrical components and ensures operational integrity of the hydraulic unit.
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention relates to power and free conveyor systems for transferring carriers between predetermined paths.
* System includes third dog for pushing carriers across transfer zones in minimum time.
* Third dog is held out of operative position by track until needed for transfer.
* Selectively operable second and third dogs allow for transfer across short or long distances.
* System maintains constant elevation of power track and carrier tracks during transfer.
* Dogs can be operated simultaneously or sequentially for efficient transfer based on distance requirements.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a grounding product for railroad car center plate assembly bowl liners made of all polymeric type materials.
• The liner material used is similar to that disclosed in previous patents but has improved electrical properties.
• The liner is composed of ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) mixed with 2.0% carbon black for conductivity.
• The liner eliminates the need for separate grounding apparatus and provides effective grounding without conductive plates or clips.
• The liner is designed to fill the space between the truck bolster bowl and body bolster center plate to prevent movement and withstand loads.
• The liner has self-lubricating properties and conducts electricity to discharge any built-up charges in the car body.
• Different embodiments of the liner include a dished bowl configuration and a flat horizontal disk design.
• The liner provides slip surfaces for swiveling action of the car trucks and meets both mechanical and electrical conductivity standards.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a gate valve for dispensing viscous substances from flexible bags or pouches.
• The valve can be operated with one hand, making it ideal for fast-food restaurants.
• It provides a seal when closed and allows for variable flow when open.
• The valve is disassemblable for easy cleaning and reassembly.
• The valve assembly includes a spout insert mounting sleeve, a guide member, and a gate valve member.
• The valve can be mounted on the spout of a bag and used in a dispenser for bulk dispensing of substances like sauces and dressings.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is directed to a vehicular rearview mirror system with an electro-optic reflective element.
* The mirror control is responsive to the output of a vehicle control, such as gear status information.
* The mirror control includes a microcomputer that determines the protocol of the vehicle control output.
* The system is tolerant of different protocols of the vehicle control output, allowing it to be used in various vehicles.
* A power-up sequence and main sequence are used to determine the protocol of the vehicle control output.
* The system adjusts parameters based on the vehicle's operation to determine the protocol accurately.
* The system utilizes software processing to determine the protocol, reducing hardware expenses.
* Changes and modifications can be made to the embodiments without departing from the principles of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention relates to movable partitions and panels for cargo transport.
* Current systems maintain entire cargo space at same temperature.
* Movable partitions and bulkheads are used for multi-temperature transport.
* Improved partition system with independently movable panels.
* Panels can be slidably attached to rails in trailer for temperature control.
* Panels can be raised and secured to ceiling when not in use.
* Panels can be used independently or together as full-width bulkheads.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles with an anti-dive device in the front suspension.
* The anti-dive device responds to the brake force applied to the front wheel, helping to minimize variations in angular deceleration.
* The system includes an anti-lock control unit, hydraulic pump, modulator, and pressure discharge valve to regulate hydraulic pressure to the front wheel brake.
* The anti-dive unit restricts the contracting action of the front fork, increasing the grounding load on the front wheel and improving braking efficiency. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a sanitizable rotary valve for liquid chromatography applications.
* The valve includes a novel diaphragm seal that allows for in-place sanitization without disassembly.
* The valve design includes features for flushing and cleaning the sealing surfaces.
* The valve can be used in simulated moving bed chromatography systems for efficient separation of components.
* The design allows for counter-current flow of eluent and feed streams in chromatographic separations.
* The valve design is adaptable for various chromatographic separation processes, including ion exchange and size exclusion chromatography.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention pertains to an improved valve-tray assembly for gas-liquid contacting trays, incorporating directional thrust valves for higher efficiency operation.
• The invention includes circular tray valves with wider frontal legs to divert liquid flow, reducing back-trapping and promoting directional thrust of vapor flow through the tray.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure.
* The assembly reduces variances in output pressure due to large differences in input pressure.
* It is inexpensive, lightweight, and portable, reducing the size and cost of a regulator needed.
* The assembly includes a vane motor that converts pressurized fluid into mechanical power.
* The vane motor can be used in various applications, such as gas grills, scuba diving gear, and vehicles driven by pressurized fluids.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to pallet systems that facilitate loading and unloading and limit the shifting of loaded items.
* The pallet system includes raised guide rails on a pallet to support trays with side supports.
* End stops on the pallet limit longitudinal movement of trays loaded on the pallet.
* End plates are secured to the trays to provide stability and protect the ends of the trays.
* The pallet system restricts both lateral and longitudinal movement of items loaded onto the pallet.
* The components of the pallet system can be customized for different types of loads.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension for aviation aircrafts.
* The design includes a compact structure, reasonable layout, and high motive power conversion efficiency.
* The rotary-wing system uses magnetic suspension to avoid contact and friction within the saucer shell.
* Two improvement solutions are provided to overcome reactive torque and ensure stable power control.
* The design includes single-rotary-wing, coaxial axial dual, and coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems.
</summary>

<summary>
* Streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands were developed.
* The muteins were produced using recombinant DNA technology.
* The muteins were used for isolation, purification, and detection of biological substances.
* The muteins had a higher binding affinity than wild-type streptavidin.
* The muteins were identified through a screening process involving fusion proteins and affinity chromatography.
* The muteins were produced on a preparative scale and characterized for their binding properties.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.
• The method involves anodizing the aluminum strip or wire, then electrolytically coloring the anodic coating.
• The apparatus includes baths for anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring, as well as a power source and means for continuous passage of the aluminum strip or wire.
• The thickness of the oxide film formed during anodic oxidation affects the color obtained during electrolytic coloring.
• Various colors can be achieved by using different electrolytic bath compositions and controlling current density and electrolysis time.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention involves methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts.
* Guanidines are important in drug development due to their biological activity.
* The methods aim to provide high yields of guanidines under mild reaction conditions.
* Preferred guanylating agents are thioureas and isothioureas.
* The reactions are carried out with nickel catalysts at less than 10 mol% nickel.
* Various protected thioureas and isothioureas can be used in the guanylation reactions.
* The reactions can be carried out at room temperature in solvent systems for high yields of guanidines.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides novel chemical compounds suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings in photolithography processes for forming submicro-patterns using 193 nm (Arf) and 248 nm (KrF) light beams in the manufacture of semiconductor devices.
• The polymers of the present invention, when used as anti-reflective coatings, prevent reflection of light from lower layers on a semiconductor chip during photolithography processes, improving product yield and stability in submicro-pattern formation processes.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor for compressing refrigerant gas by rotating a swash plate, with an improvement of applying a fluorocarbon coating to reduce frictional wear.
• The coating is a heat-curable, cross-linked coating comprising a polyfluoro elastomer, lubricious additive, and load-bearing additive, bonded directly to the aluminum swash plate.
• The coating allows for the use of lower cost, low silicon aluminum base material without the need for metal plating or high finish polishing.
• Experimental results show that the coated swash plates exhibit increased durability, low friction coefficient, and high seizure loads compared to uncoated or tin-coated swash plates. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes a process of producing transgenic plants transformed on a chromosome by assembling a DNA sequence of interest from precursor vectors in planta.
* The process involves providing plant cells with at least two different vectors, recombining them by site-specific recombination, and selecting plants expressing the desired function.
* Different transgenic plants can be produced by assembling DNA sequences of interest from different sets of precursor vectors.
* The process allows for efficient screening of DNA libraries, optimization of gene expression, and shuffling genetic elements in plants.
* The invention can be applied to a wide range of plant species for various purposes in genetic engineering and functional genomics.
</summary>

<summary>
* White, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from crystallizable thermoplastic
* Film comprises white pigment, flame retardant, and UV absorber
* Good orientability, thermoformability, optical, and mechanical properties
* UV stabilizers used to prevent yellowing and degradation from sunlight
* Flame retardants used for fire protection
* Multilayer films produced using coextrusion technology with different layer compositions
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention involves a method for producing 143a by hydrofluorinating 142b using heterogeneous catalysis.
• The process achieves high conversion and selectivity for 143a, avoiding the formation of olefinic byproducts.
• Different catalysts, such as CrF3 and Cr/Ni/AlF3, are used in the process to achieve high conversion rates.
• The process can be run at different temperatures and pressures, with the catalyst showing durability and regeneration capabilities.
• An adiabatic reactor setup is used in some experiments to demonstrate the efficiency of the process in removing olefinic materials from the final product.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of pyrazolotriazoles using hypophosphorous acid.
• Pyrazolotriazoles are useful magenta couplers for photographic products but are difficult to synthesize.
• The process involves preparation of triazolothiadiazines and subsequent desulfurization to give pyrazolotriazoles.
• The use of hypophosphorous acid reduces the formation of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities.
• The process results in higher product yield and purity compared to traditional methods.
• The compounds used in the process have inert substituents that are stable and non-reactive.
• The acylation and desulfurization reactions are conducted at specific temperatures and with specific acids.
• The process can be conducted without isolating intermediate compounds.
• The invention provides a straightforward and economical method for producing pyrazolotriazoles. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is directed to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns laid at angles of 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric, held together by stitching or adhesive bonding.
• The invention involves the use of rake mechanisms synchronized with conveyors to achieve parallelism of yarns in each layer, with the ability to overlap successive courses for increased fabric density without loss of parallelism.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types by taking partial quantities from each fiber bale.
• The method ensures that all fiber bales are opened without residual fibers and that an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained.
• A height-measuring device is used to determine the partial quantity to be removed from each fiber bale before each pass.
• The fiber removal is time-controlled to ensure that the partial quantities are removed within a predetermined period.
• The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device to control the operation of the opener.
• The control device coordinates the removal of partial quantities and the movement of the carriage on which the opener is mounted.
• Different fiber bales can have different fiber removal periods for the partial quantity.
• The method and apparatus allow for precise and efficient formation of fiber mixtures from multiple fiber types. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to weft insertion in a multiple-color air jet loom
• Different weft threads are inserted through warp sheds with varying weft carrying forces
• Air under pressure is ejected from main nozzles and subnozzles at different pressures or intervals
• Different weft carrying forces are achieved by varying subnozzle spacing, orifice diameters, or air pressure
• Control systems are used to regulate air pressure and timing for stable weft insertion
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, with a process involving health-preserving the fibres to improve flexibility and reduce breakage rates.
* The process includes steps such as health preserving the fibres, opening and carding them, and spinning them into yarn, with specific temperature, humidity, and duration requirements.
* Examples of experiments with different types of bast fibres and blends with other fibres show a reduction in end breakage rates, improving work efficiency and product quality.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention relates to buttonhole controlling devices for sewing machines
• Different materials may cause buttonholes to not close or overlap
• Device includes foot pad, travelling assembly, and adjustable stop
• Travelling assembly moves with work fed during sewing of buttonhole
• Operator can adjust stop to define closure point of buttonhole
• Device ensures neat buttonholes regardless of material being sewn
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from nip pressure profiles in nip presses.
* The invention involves strategically placing multiple sets of sensors at different cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to obtain accurate pressure measurements and compensate for rotational variability.
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention relates to a combination electrical cord support and article holder for ironing boards.
* Apparatus includes a clamp for securing to the ironing board, a flexible cord support, and a detachable article holder.
* Cord support has a flexible mast with a foot for pivotable movement and a cord receiving end.
* Article holder has a circular hoop with support bars and vertical supports, detachably mounted to the clamp. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an air flow system for a dry cleaner that brings in ambient air through the access opening without exhausting solvent vapors from the tubs.
• The machine includes a solvent flow system, an air flow system, solvent vapor handling system, and a refrigeration system to efficiently clean and dry clothes while minimizing solvent loss.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid such as a washing or rinsing solution.
* The apparatus includes a conveyor, liquid applicator, suction device, and dwell stretch to spread out the textile web and increase the contact time of the liquid with the substances to be removed.
* The apparatus allows for effective washing without stacking the textile web, making it suitable for various materials including knitted fabrics.
* Different embodiments of the apparatus are described, including one with an air pass for the dwell stretch and another with a sieve drum for guiding the textile web in a meander path.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention involves a method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments for nonwoven webs using a quench chamber and a two-dimensional slot across the machine width.
* The system eliminates the need for eductive air, improves web formation control, and allows for easy adjustment of filament denier.
* The process results in improved web uniformity, isotropicity, and energy transfer, making it suitable for various applications including sanitary products, garments, filtration, and automotive carpet.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials by using wool particles or bamboo powder as carriers for functional additives.
* The method involves pulverizing wool or bamboo fibers into ultrafine powder, forming suspensions, adding functional additives, and applying the preparation onto fabric materials.
* The preparations enhance properties such as ultraviolet protection, moisture management, wicking, and wrinkle recovery of the fabric.
* Testing shows improved ultraviolet protection, wicking, wrinkle recovery, and anti-bacterial properties in fabrics treated with the preparations.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an automatic quilting machine with separate computers controlling sewing machine functions and frame table movements, allowing for independent reprogramming of each function.
• The machine includes a computer aided design program for creating and duplicating sewing patterns, improving efficiency and accuracy in quilting large fabrics.
</summary>

<summary>
• The first embodiment describes a sewing machine with receivers to detect ultrasonic waves from an ultrasonic pen for specifying sewing positions.
• The second embodiment introduces an embroidery unit with receivers to detect ultrasonic waves for specifying embroidery positions.
• The third embodiment features an ultrasonic pen with an electromagnetic wave output circuit for transmitting signals to the sewing machine.
• The fourth embodiment includes an additional receiver on the sewing machine for detecting ultrasonic waves from the ultrasonic pen.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, ensuring continuous operation and insensitivity to disturbances.
* The device includes a stop in the feed path of the strip, controlled by a lever and air cylinder, which is retracted after being contacted by the strip to start the sewing operation.
* The device features a control setup with proximity switches and solenoid valves to control the operation of the sewing machine in accordance with the position of the stop and the strip material.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method of making a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image.
* Conventional textile fabric production involves multiple steps, while nonwoven fabrics are more efficient.
* Nonwoven fabrics are used in various applications but may lack certain properties compared to traditional textiles.
* Support layers or scrims are used to reinforce nonwoven fabrics and improve physical properties.
* Hydroentanglement techniques can impart images or patterns to nonwoven fabrics.
* The method involves providing precursor webs with different fibrous matrices and a support layer, then hydroentangling them on an imaging surface.
* The fabric can have different properties on each side, separated by a fiber distribution control layer.
* The method can include post-entanglement treatments to further modify the fabric.
* The fabric can be used in various applications, including hygiene products, medical supplies, cleaning wipes, and protective covers.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a knitting method and knit fabric for linking rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garments.
* Traditional methods involve sewing the knit fabric together, leading to increased thickness and decreased productivity.
* The new method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces on a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds.
* The end portions of the knit fabric are joined by overlaying loops and binding off gradually.
* The process is repeated until the two pieces are connected by the knitting machine.
* The method prevents the final end portion of the junction from loosening the stitch.
* The knitting machine used has multiple knitting needles on needle beds that can move back and forth.
* The method involves transferring loops between the moving and fixed needle beds to join the end portions of the knit fabric.
* The end-to-end joined state of the knit fabric is shown in detailed diagrams.
* The method can be used in various garments such as sweaters, tank tops, baseball stockings, and aprons. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a flexible traction element for lifts, made of stranded cables sheathed in a thermoplastic material.
• The production line includes a reel for unwinding cables, a device for orientation, a heater, an extruder, a cooling trough, and a cutting device.
• The method involves degreasing and preheating cables before sheathing them in a thermoplastic material.
• The stranded cables are made of materials like steel, aramid, glass, ceramic, or carbon fibers.
• The production line includes a thread guide and matrix for precise positioning of the cables in the jacket.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine.
• The rotary hook arrangement includes cams and a spring rod to prevent rotation of the bobbin housing.
• A capsule release device is used to give the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation.
• The needle thread loop is guided unhindered around the bobbin housing, reducing needle thread tension.
• The rotary hook provides jerk-free and low friction motion of the needle thread loop.
• The invention can be embodied in different ways without departing from its principles.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a sewing machine detector for detecting needle position and machine speed.
• The detector includes light shielding discs mounted on a shaft for accurate detection.
• Optical fiber supporters are used to minimize stress on the optical fibers.
• Reflecting portions on the supporters ensure accurate detection of signals.
• Power indication is done through an optical fiber cable to avoid interference with control circuitry.
• The detector is durable and compact, overcoming issues with vibration and wear.
• The design eliminates the need for curved reflecting portions, reducing manufacturing costs.
• The detector provides stable sewing machine operations by accurately detecting control signals.
• Linear support of optical fibers reduces stress and ensures long-term accuracy.
• The detector simplifies construction by allowing power indication cable to run alongside detection fibers.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to synthesis schemes and methods for producing silicon-based nanostructures and materials.
• Liquid silanes are used as precursors in the fabrication of electronic materials and nanowires.
• Electrospinning is a continuous nanofabrication technique used to produce nanowires.
• Different inks with liquid silanes, polymers, accelerants, and solid phases are used for electrospinning.
• The resulting nanowires can be transformed into amorphous or crystalline silicon materials.
• Coherent, conductive coatings can be applied to the nanowires for use in composite materials.
• The nanowires can be used as components in electrode composites for lithium-ion batteries.
• Various inks with different components, such as metal particles or quantum dots, are used for electrospinning.
• Post-deposition treatments, such as thermal processing or laser exposure, are used to transform the nanowires.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders.
* The tension control system includes brake rotors, braking elements, tensioning levers, and biasing arrangements.
* The tensioning lever is biased by the departing thread to adjust thread tension based on weight and tension.
* Existing creel arrangements automatically decrease braking force as spool wind diameter reduces.
* Different control systems like electromagnetic brakes and pneumatic biasing arrangements are known in the related art.
* The present invention allows for individual and overall thread tension control in a creel arrangement.
* A pneumatic biasing arrangement is connected to each tensioning lever for centralized control of thread tension.
* The biasing arrangement operates by fluid pressure and does not hinder the swinging action of the tension lever.
* The tensioning lever subtends an angle to the horizontal plane, and the biasing arrangement subtends an angle in the thread direction.
* An alternate embodiment replaces the friction brake with an electromagnetic brake using a magnetic system and braking disc for thread tension control.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a process for continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with high whiteness.
* The process involves completing coagulation and washing the yarn with water of non-alkaline pH.
* The yarn is treated with specific conditions to achieve a high degree of white.
* The process includes specific treatments to reduce sulphur content and improve whiteness.
* The invention simplifies the spinning process and achieves high whiteness without additional treatments.
* The process is carried out at spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min and with specific water composition for washing. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Problem of washing pulp after oxygen bleaching due to foam formation from oxygen entrained in pulp mat
• Various proposals for deaerating pulp before washing, including expensive systems with vacuum vessels
• Inventors identified need for small deaeration tank to be placed on top of oxygen reactor
• Devised system with inlet pipe, outlet, and swirl inducing inlet pipe for optimum deaeration
• Swirl inducing fluid in system is filtrate from washer after oxygen bleach
• Diagram of oxygen process from thick stock pump to washer
• Deaeration tank design with specific dimensions for inlet pipe, outlet, and filtrate inlet
• Tank height controlled by sensor, filtrate velocity at 6.1 meters per second
• Emergency bypass line included in design for upset conditions
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
* The function-oriented material design (FOMD) process is used to optimize composite materials for specific structural functions.
* The BTR composite structure includes tendon elements, stuffer members, joints, flesh, skin, and shell components.
* The BTR concept can be extended to create composite armors with added ceramic layers for blast and ballistic protection.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a load-limiting device for dissipating energy during a dynamic event in structures.
• The device may undergo plastic deformation to limit loads and can be easily replaced after deformation.
• The device is designed to prevent extensive damage to structures during seismic events.
• Different geometries of the device can be used for various bracing configurations in buildings.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a portable guard rail support for use in the construction industry to provide a safe work area for workers at dangerous heights.
* The guard rail support includes rail supporting brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring, and can be used with overlapping wooden rails or a mesh-like fence structure.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present application is a continuation-in-part of a previous patent application for a soil reinforcing connector and method.
• Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures use soil inclusions and facing elements for various applications.
• A splice system is needed to extend the length of soil reinforcing elements for MSE structures.
• The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to connect soil reinforcing elements and grid-strips.
• The splice is secured with connective devices to prevent lateral movement of the longitudinal wires.
• Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to extend the length of a single soil reinforcing element.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a plow blade design with a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, allowing for efficient production and tailored fluid injection characteristics.
* Different embodiments of the plow blade include variations in the location of the fluid tube, leading edge sections, and nozzles, providing flexibility in controlling fluid flow rates and locations for specific job requirements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to the stimulation of crude oil reservoirs using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods.
* The method involves generating acoustic and electromagnetic-acoustic vibrations to enhance oil flow and increase oil recovery.
* Different categories of methods for stimulating reservoirs are discussed, including electrical, heating, mechanical fracturing, and acoustic methods.
* The invention uses a combination of direct EH acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations for enhanced stimulation.
* Multiple sources in multiple wells can be used to extend the range of stimulation and optimize the desired effect.
* The invention includes improvements in electrode design, directional energy control, and separation of recovered fluids into components.
* Various separation methods such as membrane processes, fractionation, cryogenic separation, and solvent extraction can be used to separate components from recovered fluids.
* Recovery of heavy metals from recovered fluids can be achieved using specific methods such as mixing with red mud or tar sand.
* The invention provides a comprehensive approach to enhancing oil recovery from reservoirs using innovative stimulation techniques and separation processes.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a unit type bedroom cabinet for flophouse facilities.
• The cabinet is designed to maximize space and provide comfort for users.
• The design includes inner and outer casings with clearance for devices and belongings.
• The cabinet is assembled with resilient clip members and ornamental webs for a secure fit.
• A second embodiment includes spacer members for ventilation and sound-proofing throughout the cabinet.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to safes for valuable papers and articles.
* Various prior art safe structures are discussed, including those embedded in concrete or free-standing.
* The safe design includes grooves for door placement, lock assembly, and reinforcement against intrusion attempts.
* Two embodiments of the safe construction are described, one with bar members and the other with concrete and rebars for structural integrity.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is an evolution of the MCL StuccoRite® Cavity Wall System, incorporating proprietary plaster and reinforcement materials.
* The system includes battens, mesh sheets, uPVC mouldings, and sealants for moisture protection.
* Movement control joints are provided at specified locations to accommodate building movement.
* Components such as bottom members, head flashings, and jam flashings are used for window and door openings.
* The system is designed for timber framing with specific spacing and reinforcement requirements.
* Mesh sheets are stapled to battens and overlapped for reinforcement, with additional mesh used at corners and openings.
* Various flashing components and sealants are used for weatherproofing and moisture protection.
* The system is completed with a waterproof coating and meets performance requirements of the Building Code.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a method for accurately measuring fluid pressures in geological formations at desired depths, isolating the pressure sensor from other pressures in the borehole.
* The method involves using a filter and check valve in a borehole, pumping fluid to clear the filter of grout, displacing grout to form a fluid connection to the formation, and fracturing the formation to allow formation fluid to flow to the pressure transducer.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function and a method of mounting an elastic member.
• The structure includes steps at the traveling path ends, elastic members mounted inside the steps, and a joint block across the expansion gap.
• The structure prevents tire fall-in/stuck-in situations, absorbs bridge girder expansion/contraction, and ensures smooth vehicle traveling.
• Different embodiments show variations in expansion gap configurations and the use of supporting blocks.
• The method of mounting the elastic member involves joining them, fixing them to the steps, and deforming them towards the bridge girder axis.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to floor track systems for transporting food stuffs in sanitary fluid treatment chambers.
• Conventional methods of cooling cooked meat products result in dehydration and slow heat transfer.
• Recent approaches use fluid treatment chambers with chilled brine solution for quick heat transfer.
• Overhead rail systems have limitations in fixed routes and contamination of solution by lubricating grease.
• Wheeled floor trucks offer mobility but wheels can become contaminated, affecting solution sanitation.
• The invention aims to provide a floor transport system that prevents contamination of treatment fluid by truck wheels.
• Two embodiments of the enclosed floor track system are described, one for horizontally axled hand trucks and another for hand trucks with downwardly depending struts.
• The system includes wheel channels, support legs, and inflatable elastomer seals to prevent solution contamination.
• The system allows for the recovery and reuse of brine solution without the need for decontamination.
• The invention enhances the efficiency and sanitation of fluid treatment chambers for meat products. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The lock device prevents a work machine from tilting by its weight, specifically preventing a backhoe boom from rotating downward.
* The lock device includes an engaging member on the boom or boom bracket, an engaged member on the other, and guide members to support and guide the engaging member.
* The lock plate can be easily operated manually to lock or release the boom, preventing damage and ensuring stability.
* The lock device is applicable for locking booms, arms, or other components in construction machines like excavators, loaders, and cranes.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with an adjustable central vacuum portion for regulating suction efficiency.
• Prior art devices lacked the ability to regulate suction pressure during cleaning operations.
• The apparatus allows for real-time adjustment of suction without needing to adjust the suction source.
• The device includes adjustment mechanisms on the top of the vacuum head for precise regulation of suction.
• A kit form of the adjustment mechanism can be added to existing pool cleaning devices with minor modifications.
</summary>

<summary>
* Vibratory tool for downhole use with passage for wireline or other tools
* Dump valve annularly disposed to prevent slamming against seat
* Modular stacked piston units increase power delivery
* Plug lands on seat to close passage and initiate vibration
* Valve opens and closes without impacts, increasing reliability
* Tool can be operated with or without impacts on each cycle
* Components delivered within body, eliminating need for dart assembly
* Valve design reduces wear and fatigue on components
* Tool can be matched to power required for specific work string
* Tool can be used in stimulation or fishing operations, providing large amplitude vibrations
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil well drilling tools.
* Wear bushings protect against excessive wear in casing heads and other well head elements.
* Existing methods involve using a retriever body with protruding dowels to engage a wear sleeve.
* A new apparatus is proposed with a sub-unit for mounting onto a drill string and a retriever section for engaging wear bushings.
* The apparatus allows for vertical movement of the retriever unit while preventing rotational movement.
* The retriever section has protruding members for engaging with wear bushings or a threaded end for threaded engagement.
* Grooves on the mandrel section of the sub-unit allow for vertical play of the retriever unit.
* The apparatus is designed to retrieve wear bushings without removing the drill bit from the hole.
* The operation involves lowering the apparatus into the hole, engaging with the wear bushing, and rotating to retrieve it.
* The new design prevents damage to the wear bushing or the retriever unit due to excessive weight during retrieval.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to systems and methods for delivering heat at the down hole end of oil or gas wells to improve production.
* Existing down hole heating systems have shortcomings in focusing heat and protecting electrical components from damage.
* The present invention addresses these shortcomings by focusing heat in the production zone and protecting electrical connections with high temperature cement and steel encasement.
* The system includes production tubing, heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, stainless steel collars, and electrical resistance type heater rods.
* The method involves using the down hole heating unit to treat oil or gas wells with high viscosity or paraffin blockage to improve flow rates.
* Modifications and alternative embodiments of the invention are contemplated to cover various applications in the field.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a precast concrete retaining wall for use alongside highways and railways.
* The design includes a face panel with integral counterforts and a precast base, allowing for taller walls and shorter bases.
* The connection between the face panel and base is made using rebar and grout, eliminating the need for temporary shoring.
* Additional stability measures, such as H-piles or a vehicle impact barrier, can be incorporated into the design.
* The system is flexible, customizable, and can be pre-manufactured for cost savings in installation and transportation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that may be stuck or lost within a well bore.
• The mechanism includes a collet or spear structure for establishing internal connection with objects to be pulled from the well bore.
• A controllable locking mechanism is provided to ensure selective latching and unlatching of the pulling tool from the object.
• The mechanism can be used for a variety of down hole service operations, such as fishing operations for stuck or lost tools within the well bore.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to ladder attachments for stability, preventing damage to work surfaces, and preventing slipping.
• Ladders are used for reaching high places, but can be unstable and damage work surfaces.
• The invention provides braces with large contact areas to increase stability and prevent damage.
• The braces can be attached to ladder siderails and have resilient pads for grip.
• The braces can straddle corners and pivot horizontally for versatility.
• The invention improves ladder stability, contact area, and prevents damage to work surfaces.
</summary>

<summary>
• Example embodiment relates to modular composed stave floors
• Known stave floors have drawbacks due to thin sight substrate thickness
• Example embodiment provides method for manufacture of composed stave floors
• Method includes providing sight substrate with thickness of at least 4 mm and base substrate with thickness of at least 12 mm
• Multidirectional holding means used for assembly include dendrites, glue, and reinforcement means
• Example embodiment aims to preserve physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of sight substrate
• Example embodiment prevents deformation and detachment in composed stave floors
• Glaze applied from supplier to improve durability of floors
• Example embodiment provides increased durability and allows for corrective maintenance
• Variations in example embodiments are considered within the scope of the claims
</summary>

<summary>
* Nozzle for applying sealants in multiple artifacts or machines
* Useful in aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics industries
* Bell-shaped tip and injection button for precise sealant application
* Overcomes drawbacks of current nozzles in the market
* Injection button with channels and orifices for accurate sealing operations
* Can be used manually or with automated sealant injection machines
* Provides optimum sealing of rivets and nuts in various industries
* Two embodiments with different injection button designs
* Made of plastic, preferably polypropylene
* Simplifies sealing work, saves time and labor, and improves quality of sealant application
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool.
* The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, reducing debris generation during driving.
* The plastic material is an adhesive polymer, such as a blend of polypropylene and a maleic anhydride modified polypropylene.
* The connecting portion of the collation system includes a preferentially weakened region to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location.
* Various configurations of the collation system, including tapered collars, embossed patterns, and eccentric nail placements, are discussed to enhance performance.
* The collation system is designed to minimize debris, increase nail penetration into the substrate, and improve withdrawal strength of the nails.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to sensors for monitoring position and motion of objects.
• The sensor system allows for multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires.
• An error correction generator eliminates static signals and error signals that do not provide position information.
• The sensor includes a waveform generator and a window reference circuit for signal conditioning.
• The sensor draws minimal current upon startup and can be recalibrated easily.
• The sensor modulates current across two wires connected to a monitoring system for converting into a voltage signal.
</summary>

<summary>
* Light member for aquarium lighting using LEDs
* Housing with top and bottom sides, lighting control region on bottom side
* Control channels for white and blue light, switch for each channel
* Modules with LEDs for emitting white or blue light, coupled to control channels
* Optional RF module for remote control, in-line timers for scheduling
* Can be used for aquariums or under cabinets for lighting
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines in automobiles.
• The system eliminates the need for springs in valve actuation, allowing for higher engine speeds and efficiency.
• The system allows for infinitely variable valve displacement, controlled by a rotating cam and translating means.
• Computer control of each valve allows for efficient operation of the engine based on performance requirements.
• The system can be applied to engines with multiple valves per cylinder, offering precise and repeatable valve timing.
• The control function of the system involves adjusting the circular drive disk to vary valve displacement.
• The system can be integrated into a four-valve cylinder assembly, with control blocks for each intake valve.
• The invention offers a simple, robust, and efficient valve actuation system for internal combustion engines.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, allowing for automatic or manual control.
* The system includes a control unit that processes signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve to set the throttle position for optimal performance.
* The system can smoothly switch between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch or stall, providing full operation of the vehicle in manual mode.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to evaporative air conditioning, specifically focusing on cooling air without adding water vapor by using a heat exchanger to separate the evaporating water from the useful air.
* The system utilizes return air from the load for evaporation, achieving high efficiency in cooling air, and can be further enhanced by incorporating a vapor compression refrigeration unit for dehumidification and additional cooling.
</summary>

<summary>
• Waste fuel burner designed to emit minimal particulate materials within environmental regulations
• Operates with little slag or clinkers, can burn wet wood with high moisture content
• Self-regulating, easy to control, fast response times to load changes
• Burns wood with nominal ash content, residue free of clinkers
• Method involves forming a conical pile of waste fuel, percolating preheated underfire air through pile
• Volatile gases partially oxidized in primary combustion chamber with swirl air, additional combustion air
• Secondary combustion chamber for complete combustion with tangentially introduced air
• Combustion air introduced on outside of refractory lining to cool and increase life
• Pressure isolator in second embodiment isolates primary chamber from secondary chamber air
• Can be used for any source of dirty particulate-laden combustible gas, provides clean burning and removal of particulate matter
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures.
* Current flow deflection apparatuses, like stator or rotor blades in a gas turbine, use internal cooling channels to reduce metal temperatures.
* The invention introduces separate inserts for separating walls in the cooling channels, instead of casting them with the apparatus.
* Advantages of using inserts include reduced material in transitional regions, no thermal stresses, and lower blade weight.
* Inserts can be made of metal or non-metal materials and can be easily replaced to adjust the cooling system.
* The flow deflection apparatus can be a blade in a gas turbine, with the inserts being connected securely to the blade.
* Inserts can be straight or bent into a U-shape for deflection, and holders in the form of rails guide the inserts during insertion.
* The invention simplifies assembly, reduces thermal stresses, and allows for flexible adjustments in the cooling system. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Fluid pump with multiple pump heads in series for high volumetric flow rate and high pressure
* Pump heads have impellers driven by a common drive structure
* Combining fluid flow from multiple conduits into a single flow
* Drive structure passing through pump heads for common driving of impellers
* Modularity allows for easy maintenance and addition of more pump heads
* Pump assembly can be mounted on wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer
* Agitator nozzle for mixing fluid in reservoir and fluid conduit for transferring pumped fluid
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders.
• Traditional engine brake systems have one brake per cylinder, but excess components can be removed for improved engine robustness.
• The invention includes an engine with brakes for only a portion of the cylinders.
• A method of engine braking using less than all cylinders is described.
• The engine includes a high pressure pump, electronic control module, and cylinders with pistons.
• Each cylinder has a fuel injector, exhaust valve, and some have engine brakes.
• The engine brake system includes solenoids, valve members, and pistons for each brake.
• The operation of the engine brake involves activating and deactivating the solenoid to control fluid flow and move the piston to open the exhaust valve.
• Modifications to the engine brake system are possible, including different orientations and structures for the components.
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention relates to archery equipment for attaching arrow points and balancing arrow shafts.
* Point cap system provides adjustable weight for perfect balance.
* Utilizes point cap, balance pin, and adaptors to improve arrow shaft attachment and prevent dirt entry.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an air intake device for internal combustion engines.
• The device includes a tank, two pipes of different sizes, and a valve for engine performance improvement.
• The smaller pipe acts as a resonator to reduce intake noise.
• The valve operation is based on engine speed and load conditions for optimal performance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox.
• Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes are designed to withstand various loads, including extreme shocks from blade-off events.
• Conventional gearboxes are constructed to rigidly withstand all anticipated loads, often requiring additional material or being heavier.
• The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin to selectively retain the male and female links.
• The female link allows translation of the male link relative to it, forming a radial interface that dampens translation.
• The mounting link can absorb extreme shocks without detaching the gearbox from the engine or transmitting destructive loads.
• The pin serves as a fusible link that shears at a known load magnitude to prevent damage to the gearbox and attached peripherals.
• The radial interface between the female and male links provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy during translation.
• The snap ring limits the relative travel of the male link within the female link to prevent separation after the pin is sheared.
• The use of the pin and coulomb damping eliminates the need for all linkages to survive extreme loads, reducing weight and material requirements.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training.
• It provides a cost-effective and realistic simulation of small arms fire without modifying the weapon.
• The simulator utilizes a plastic expendable housing pyrotechnic charges and an electrical ignition system.
• The circuitry includes various functional blocks such as bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillators, firing counter, firing decoder, and firing control.
• The simulator is packaged in a reusable housing resembling a magazine clip of an M16 rifle.
• The plastic expendable contains pyrotechnic charges sealed in cups, which are ignited by heating a bridge wire to produce sound and flash simulating small arms fire.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a two-part bracket system that allows for easy mounting of speakers or other equipment to poles, flat surfaces, or other structures.
• The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, allowing for one-person installation of heavy items with minimal effort and robust components.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a burner for heat utilizing appliances, with a focus on optimizing efficiency and limiting emissions.
* The burner includes a combustion chamber with a fuel holder, surrounded by an outer wall and a shroud for supporting secondary and tertiary combustion.
* Additional features include legs for support, a pivotally coupled ash pan, a perforate food grate, and a cover for safety and ember control.
* The burner can be coupled with modular heat utilizing appliances such as cookers, smokers, space heaters, and pyrolyzers.
* The system includes interchangeable appliances like closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer, each with specific features for their intended use.
</summary>

<summary>
* Rotary internal combustion engines require efficient cooling systems to improve fuel economy and durability.
* Uneven heating in the combustion chamber can lead to housing distortion and oil film destruction.
* In-line spark plug arrangements disrupt cooling flow, leading to overheating and structural failures.
* Staggered spark plug boss configuration improves coolant flow and heat transfer in the housing.
* The offset arrangement of spark plug terminals promotes efficient combustion and cooling.
* Tests show that staggered spark plug bosses increase heat transfer coefficient by up to 44%.
* The staggered configuration prevents vapor accumulation and ensures controlled flow regime.
* The offset of spark plug terminals should be less than the radius of the boss for optimal performance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
• The method uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain total mass flow through parallel valves constant, minimizing steam boiler pressure changes and turbine power changes.
